A number of different buses run between Burford and other local towns.
By car you can reach Burford easily via the A40 from Oxford or Cheltenham directions. Otherwise you can come in from the direction of

on the A424 which is a beautiful drive.

There is a free car-park at the bottom end of town, and car-parking on the streets. Be careful, though, as parking in some areas is limited to 2 hours - this is clearly marked. Most of the hotels also have their own car-parking.
There's no station in Burford, but the nearest one is in
, which is on the line to
. There are direct trains to London Paddington twice an hour.
The town is small enough to walk everywhere. The lovely high street has many shops, pubs and tea rooms to spend a pleasant afternoon browsing.

value: content=Large anglican church in Burford. Built in 1175, the church has some interesting features.

Walk. There is a lovely walk from Burford to Little and Great Barrington.
As with much of the Cotswolds

are a big thing in Burford. There are regular Antique fairs which take place at the church and in one of the buildings on the high street. There are also a number of constant antique shops selling some beautiful things.

value: content=A lovely tea room serving anything from a traditional cream tea with home-baked scones to a good plate of bangers and mash. Very popular with locals and tourists alike. Child friendly.
content=Good food, pleasant interior. A stones throw from the High Street.
content=Restaurant serving traditional food in a traditional setting.

There are a number of good pubs in Burford with pints costing around £2.50 to £3 each.

value: content=A 16th century coaching inn. Pub serving food.
content=A traditional pub in small village near Burford. On the River Windrush, with great garden and traditional pub meals. Worth a visit for a pint, or to stay.

isn't too far away and is a good next stop if you're leaving the Cotswolds. Bus no. 853 runs to Oxford and surrounding towns. Check the schedule as this does not run frequently - especially on Sunday.

If you want to see other attractive villages in the Cotswolds, then

could be good places to head to.

Roads are flat and good for cycling.
